---
applyTo: "**"
---

# Checking for package updates

This document provides instructions on how to check for updates to npm and Rust packages in your project.

## Checking for npm updates

Run the following command to check for outdated npm packages:

```bash
npm outdated
```

This will list all the packages that are outdated, along with their current version, wanted version, and latest version.

## Checking for Rust updates

Run the following command to check for outdated Rust packages:

```bash
cargo outdated
```

This will list all the packages that are outdated, along with their current version, latest version, and the version specified in your `Cargo.toml`.

```bash
npm outdated
```

This will list all the packages that are outdated, along with their current version, wanted version, and latest version.

## Checking for Rust updates

Run the following command to check for outdated Rust packages:

```bash
cargo outdated
```

This will list all the packages that are outdated, along with their current version, latest version, and the version specified in your `Cargo.toml`.
